math_history_facts.fact: Counting on fingers – Long ago, people used their fingers, toes, or even small stones to count.
Zero was new – The number 0 didn’t exist in early math.
The oldest math problem – A clay tablet from Babylon (over 3,500 years old).
The word 'mathematics' – It comes from the Greek word 'mathema', which means 'learning'.
The Egyptians loved triangles – They used triangles to build the pyramids with amazing precision.
π (pi) never ends – The number π (3.14159...) goes on forever without repeating.
Math saves lives – From guiding ships across oceans to landing astronauts on the Moon.
